$! You must tell DVLA if you have a benign essential tremor. $!

% You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted. %

##Car, motorcycle, bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form B1 and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download 'B1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 313KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066652.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have a benign essential tremor - download the correct form to let them know
title: Benign essential tremor and driving
